newsitem.title: UK: Japanese Stocks in London firm amid profit-taking.
newsitem.headline: Japanese Stocks in London firm amid profit-taking.

text.p: Japanese stocks closed firmer on Friday amid some profit-taking before the weekend.
"The Nikkei/ISE 50 index was up 4.48 points or 0.28 percent, at 1,604.59 points.
Earlier, the Nikkei 225 average in Tokyo marked a new year's high of 20,815.48 points, before traders locked in their profits, sending down the index to close 36.11 points lower at 20,528.35 points.
"It has been a cautious day. We saw some profit-taking and bargain-hunting", one trader said.
Sumitomo Bank was the most actively traded share in London. The stock was up 40 yen to 1,827.5 yen. This compares with a rise of 60 yen to a close of 1,830 yen in Tokyo.
Toyo Trust shares were up 38 yen to 887.5 yen, but some 10 yen off from Tokyo's close.
Kyocera was down 340 yen to 8,695 yen, after order intake in May declined.
